website_summaries.verdict: If you already have a premium sound system in your home, upgrading to smart speakers with all the benefits of Alexa is as simple as plugging in an Echo Input.
pros: Plug into Bluetooth or AUX port to make any speaker an Echo device
cons: Echo Input does not support Bluetooth calling

customer_reviews.title: The Echo Input has a magnetic backing that can be used with a magnetic mount in the car.
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up after downloading the Alexa app update. I am using it in my car with a cellular hotspot and the bluetooth system.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy

customer_reviews.title: Solution in search of a problem
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't do anything a dot doesn't do. Given current pricing, pass this up.
customer_reviews.author: Edward F Shea III

customer_reviews.title: 2nd or 3rd gen DOT is a much better choice and value
customer_reviews.text: Meh, get a DOT instead for the price. It will do everything the Echo Input will do and more. The description informs you that the Input will not support drop in, or calling. But it also does not support the echo remote. Even a refurbished 2nd gen DOT will cost half and do more.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Wow, I love this!
customer_reviews.text: I have an old Bose Soundock II, which was made to both play and charge an iPod (long before the advent of Bluetooth). It has remarkable sound, but who wants to listen to the same music over and over? I just hooked up my Echo and Bose speaker using the Echo Input without too much trouble and I'm thrilled to have the Prime Music library, combined with premium sound, available. Thanks for another great product, Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Susan MannionTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A thriller
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Input immediately became a wonderful surprise; it feels like getting a very low price on Alexa, by using some speakers I already owned. I have over a dozen Alexa devices, every speaker option, but this thing offers a sense of independence to use alternative speakers. This is well worth the cost, even to just experiment with the device and connection options. -- the initial test is with the use of some old $20 Logitech Z130 speakers -- see Logitech 3.5mm Jack Compact Laptop Speakers, Black (Z130)
customer_reviews.author: T-Rex "Gas"osaurus

customer_reviews.title: My Whole Home Audio System just got a whole lot smarter.
customer_reviews.text: "Alexa, play Ed Sheeran's Candle in the Wind on Kitchen Speakers" / "Alexa, change the volume on the Patio Speakers to 5" We have a 19 year old home with great in ceiling speakers. To manage them previously we tried goofing around with airplay and then go click on the wall jack to pick the correct source, etc. I bypassed the pre-amp altogether and removed it and hooked Echo Input devices directly to our Sonance Amps that drive the 13 sets of speakers in our home. You can create speaker groups, and even set up routines to play certain playlists.
customer_reviews.author: BRYANDERSON

customer_reviews.title: Great idea - one big issue with execution!
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea. Wanted to connect to a Bose speaker I have also connected to my TV. Main issue - and the only reason why I will be returning it- is that the wired output gain/volume level from this device is way too low. You have to turn volume of the speaker you connect it to way too high, which means if I switch from my this Echo Input to my TV into the speaker, I have to jump on the remote to lower the volume. Make the Input’s gain/volume adjustable within the Alexa app, and I’ll buy it. For now, it’s too inconvenient to keep. Despite having a bunch of Alexa Echo/Dot already ...
customer_reviews.author: FL

customer_reviews.title: Transformed my old (20year) Bose Wave CD player!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to see if I could transform my ancient Bose wave CD player (which still has incredible sound) into wi-fi so I could play my music. Worked perfectly and set up in minutes with no issue (and I am NOT tech savvy). Now I get the Bose sound from my cloud music. It really saved me $$$ as I was at the point of investing in a new Wave. Now I don’t have to. Fantastic product. Plus it still has all the features of my Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: A. DD

customer_reviews.title: Quirky little devices.  Buy a Dot instead
customer_reviews.text: Quirky. I have several other Echo devices in the house - all generations. Would never have bought these Inputs at the original suggested retail price. A Dot is a better deal. But when they were on sale decided to try a few. Quirky things are always complaining in the Alexa app they are not connected - when they are. The volume out is less than a dot and not easy to check or change from the device. Overall the oddest little Echo devices of the many Echo devices I have. Most I like.
customer_reviews.author: Sting J

customer_reviews.title: Great Amazon Echo ,Great life !
customer_reviews.text: I must this great device that I been used just one day .The Echo Input connects to my current speaker via Bluetooth or AUX cable (either works), and after download the Amazon Alexa App ,it could to be controlled by voice, just calls :Alexa !The microphones heard as well as the mics in other Echo devices, even at a distance to say "Alexa" ! I put it into my living room and connect all my smart devices, such as Philip Hue Smart light bulbs. Ecobee and even Dome alarm systems. One Echo, One App, it’s integrated every smart device. Great Amazon Echo ,Great life !
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: It’s not a dot! It’s alexa in your car.
customer_reviews.text: I have basically every Alexa device. I use her for a billion things. With input I now have Alexa in the car. The little disc clips to a magnetic phone car mount , I set it up to my phones hotspot (considering getting it a mobile hotspot of its own) , plugged it in the auxiliary an viola ! Alexa is mobile. I can make calls and control music via my voice while driving and it hears me very well even when loud music is playing.
customer_reviews.author: Silly Girl

customer_reviews.title: Use with Bose Wave system... love it
customer_reviews.text: Using this Alexa device for older model Bose wave radio system. Didn't want to spend the money thru Bose for their Bluetooth adapter. This fits the bill and provides added benefit of adding another Alexa device to our smarthome configuration. I would definitely recommend is you have an older model system with no Bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: DataDr

customer_reviews.title: I think this Alexa is hard of hearing.
customer_reviews.text: I used the Echo Input to transform an old Bose Wave radio into a smart speaker
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that its so compact and responds so well and its priced right. I have a Bose Wave radio without built in Bluetooth. I tried adding a Bluetooth receiver which did not work out. I became aware of the Echo Input. Connected it to the Aux input, now I can stream the music I want to it. Awesome!
customer_reviews.author: gildrush

customer_reviews.title: Goes not work well with AmazonBasics Large Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to use with my my AmazonBasics Large Portable Bluetooth Speaker. Was hoping to use Alexa to play Amazon Music Unlimited. The problem is even with the 3.5mm jack hooked up the bluetooth overrides that connection and the speaker disconnects from the Echo input about 3 minutes after song is played or request is made. You have to manually recycle the power on the speaker to restore the connection. Now I have an Echo Input I hardly ever use. Waste of money in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Set Up....added it to my iHome iAV5v2 color changing portable speaker!
customer_reviews.text: Echo Input was an easy set up...I did a simple BT pairing to my portable iHome iAV5v2 portable speaker that I use in the garage. The iHome iAV5v2 uniquely designed to dock the Echo Input and the sound was great. Great way to bring Alexa to the garage and deck with my portable iHome color changing speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Mustang

customer_reviews.title: Small form factor is great - and it just works!
customer_reviews.text: I got this hoping it would work in my car with my iphone hotspot wifi - and it does! Took a few minutes to connect up initially, but now it works great! I have Alexa in my car! The USB charging cable made it easy to connect for power. And the small, flat shape makes it easy to place on the dashboard.
customer_reviews.author: Genedba

customer_reviews.title: Does It Need A Speaker?
customer_reviews.text: We do not have a speaker attached to our Echo Input, as we only intend to use it as an adjunct input to the main Echo. However, while it works, it is much less precise than the Echo. A careful delay is required between hailing and instruction, and commands must frequently be repeated.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works better than my DOT for stereo application
customer_reviews.text: When the price dropped to $20 I bought one and I'm pleased. The 4 microphones can hear me across a large room. I have this plugged into my Pioneer receiver to stream music from SiriusXM and Amazon Music. I have it hard wired using a 3.5 male to RCA male cable I had lying around. The device only includes a 3.5 male to 3.5 male cable which will work fine for speakers with an AUX input. Prior to buying this I would connect my DOT via bluetooth to the receiver which worked okay but added a connect and disconnect step. For a small price this is more convenient and my DOT can now focus on business in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: M2

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Device
customer_reviews.text: At first, it is hard to understand what this does. Once you start playing with it, you realize how incredible the functionality is. Basically, for $20, you add Alexa functionality to any speaker with a headset (stereo jack) input or, you can convert any bluetooth wireless speaker into an Alexa-enabled speaker. I have used one of these to add streaming/Alexa capability to an old Bose Wave Radio. Second, I use this to extend multi-room speaker to a wireless speaker in my balcony. PRETTY AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.author: Inomad360

customer_reviews.title: Apple Music not available with Echo Input
customer_reviews.text: This device is sold as being compatible with Apple Music. I ask Alexa to play me something from Apple Music. She responds “In order to play Apple Music, this device needs an update. Ask me to check for software update.” I ask her to do a software update. She responds that the device is up to date. But still no Apple Music. Also, this device has other features that are missing with conflicting claims in the description of this device.
customer_reviews.author: JClaborn

customer_reviews.title: A great substitute for the upcoming Alexa auto
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 Echos Dots throughout the house. Love them and use them daily. I have been on the waiting/'invitation only' list for an Alexa auto for months now. Still waiting, but when I saw this on sale for $20, I thought I would give it a try and retrofit it to make it work in my car until maybe the real Alexa auto arrives. Works great and I am thinking this is essentially what the Alexa auto will be. The Alexa auto will maybe have better mics for car & different mounting options, but just speculation.
customer_reviews.author: mfranch87

customer_reviews.title: Low profile, easy to set up, and works with Dot & Spot
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my husband wanted to use with his Harmon bluetooth speaker. Low profile, nearly disappears on his black desktop. Easy to set up and the blue tooth works like a charm. I love that it works with Dot & Spot network. The only down side (and 4 instead of 5 stars) is that DropIn feature doesn't work as long as bluetooth is enabled. So I can't use the intercom function to talk to him from the kitchen when he's working in his den. That was the best part -- I was hoping no more hollering for dinner, etc. If you want the dropin function, get a spot or dot.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly Grant

customer_reviews.title: Only Fair
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Input is barely less expensive than the Dot, and considerably less functional. When using the 3.5mm jack, the max volume of the Echo Input is much less than the max of the Echo Dot. As such, you'll have to increase the volume of your speaker(s). In my setup, it was already maxed out, so I ended up using the Dot I previously had connected, as it's unacceptable to me to lose volume. It also seems that the Input doesn't "hear" as well as the Dot does.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: I'm listening / Maybe spying on you
customer_reviews.text: When I was having a conversation Echo Input responded to a word that was said, "Chip". No one in the room mentioned "Alexa what is..." but Alexa started to talk and provided the definition of Potato Chip. I said "that thing is spying on us". Alexa then responded again by stating the Amazon privacy policy but NO ONE said "Alexa what is...". I keep hearing News Reports that Alexa is listening and possibly spying on your conversation, now I know it is. I unplug the device when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Needs a digital output to be worth it
customer_reviews.text: I used my input to being streamed music to An older (but high-end) Denon receiver. The input does a great job of “hearing” commands even when the music is up high. BUT: I rarely use my input because the sound quality is pretty poor (even using a paid Spotify account with the higher quality streams, it’s not as good as just connecting my phone) I think it would make a huge difference if the input had a digital out with a raw stream so that I could use the really great DAC in my receiver instead of the cheap one in the input. As it is, this thing just isn’t worth $30
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Marsch

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I paired my Alexa Input with an Amazon Bluetooth 4.0 receiver ($20). I attached the Bluetooth receiver to my old but good stereo and speakers. The Alexa Input was easy to pair to the Bluetooth receiver and works well. Now i can just lay on my sofa and ask Alexa to play whatever I'm in the mood for. I pay monthly for Amazon music ($7.99) which is worth it. I no longer buy CD's I may be 64 years old, but I still love my music.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth W Laurance

customer_reviews.title: Update your software!
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review. Out of the box my Input did not perform well - dropouts and skipped music all day. I got a proactive call from Amazon! The very pleasant CSR helped me update the software in the Input (Alexa update your software) and now the Input is running smoothly as I hoped
customer_reviews.author: NMGardner

customer_reviews.title: oops, Oh yeah, we neglected to mention that in the description.
customer_reviews.text: This "Echo" will not pair with "Echo remote" but no indication of that in product description. Even product specialist rep had to go research it and after several minutes "discovered" that fact.
customer_reviews.author: J. Conley

customer_reviews.title: Issues....
customer_reviews.text: Overall ok. Set was easy enough. Bluetooth connects fast. But......audio quality issues. Bluetooth is a bit distorted. And the real issue is line out. 3.5mm line out volume is terrible. So low it is useless. When connecting echo input with 3.5mm jack to speaker the volume out sounds like its covered by a pillow. So if your planning on using bluetooth it's all good. If your planning on hard wiring with the 3.5mm jack you'll be dissapionted. I will be returning mine. Hopefully they will address this issue soon
customer_reviews.author: F pickels

customer_reviews.title: Update your Bose Wave Radio CD with this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product after reading reviews stating it could be added to the Bose Wave Radio CD to make it Alexa enabled. It works great, but you will need an RCA cable with red and white plugs instead of the cable included with the Input. I had one in my box of extra cables, so easy fix. Set the Alexa volume to 10 and adjust the Bose volume with its remote. I love being able to update old technology to extend its usefulness! The only slight annoyance I've found is Alexa's voice is softer than the Amazon music, so I need to adjust the volume up and down when talking to Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Makes any speaker with 3.5m plug a 'smart' one
customer_reviews.text: It solved two of of my requirements: It made my BOSE bookshelf speaker 'smart'. It also makes the speaker bluetooth enabled so I can stream music from my phone. Please note that this does NOT allow streaming from Spotify Free (you need premium for streaming). Fortunately, I have Amazon Prime so it can stream from Amazon music.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: I love that I can use this with my existing audio set up.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to use with my garage radio via an aux cable. I was originally considering the Echo Dot, but wasn't thrilled with the sound quality, as I wanted something that I would be able to hear over power tools and such. This suited my needs perfectly! I love having the handsfree capability of Alexa, along with the ability to stream Pandora, while being able to use my current radio for audio. The input is small and compact, and works the same as my larger original Amazon Echo I currently have in the house. I especially love that I can 'drop in' from the garage into my home Echo device.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Echo Devices Cannot Playback Music in HiFi
customer_reviews.text: Audiofiles beware: Amazon Echo devices are incapable of playing back anything beyond 320k AAC. From Tidal Support: Thank you for reaching out to TIDAL via chat - it was pleasure speaking with you . I have done some research regarding AMAZON devices ALEXA/ECHO DOT . Amazon Alexa's and echo devices currently don't stream HiFi- so they will stream Normal and High! Normal quality: 96 kbps (AAC +) High quality: 320 kbps (AAC) Let me know if you have any other questions , I will be happy to help. Thank you for being TIDAL subscriber ! Best Regards, TIDAL Member Support
customer_reviews.author: DL Agatep

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Input is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Pairing the Input with my phone through the Alexa App was easy. Everything that I needed to install the Input into my old 2009 Civic came with the Input: the power adapter, a micro-USB cable, and a 3.5 mm audio cable. After getting the Input into my phone's hotspot connection, my no-bluetooth car turned into a Pandora/Amazon Music dream! Like, surround-sound music in my car, it's great! I'm tempted to get another one for my 2014 Odyssey even though it has Bluetooth. My Civic will be passed on to our 16-year-old and I felt that it was important to have a voice-activated device to allow hands-free access to her phone so that she can focus on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2Ks

customer_reviews.title: WATERED DOWN “NOT AN ECHO DEVICE” (change the NAME)
customer_reviews.text: Bought as potential gifts, Amazon left in the snow and marred the packaging. Now that I have tried to put to work; we learn that “drop in” listed as a feature on Amazon’s site is only half true. Even when not paired with Bluetooth devices you can not drop into this device. Had it not been a watered down it would have been a great addition to my devices. 👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼 Booo! VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S Easley

customer_reviews.title: I love this little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it in my car, bluetoothed to a small speaker and have it connected to the net via the hotspot on my phone. I have a 2010 vehicle w/basic audio. Now, I can have ALEXA access when I'm driving. I do love that when on my way home from work and tell her to turn on my home lights for me and I'm not walking into a dark home.
customer_reviews.author: SonoraTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay connected to speakers - and therefore becomes useless
customer_reviews.text: This device simply cannot stay connected to the Bose Speakers that I purchased with it in a bundle. Almost daily I am forced to "disconnect the device" from my alexa app, turn off bluetooth, then reinstall the speakers. Since this lovely device cannot speak, you don't know it's not working until you go to your phone and see the error message. It seems like it should still be in testing as not all of the kinks are worked out. Just get a dot...
customer_reviews.author: K. Ardito

customer_reviews.title: Check Out Echo Dot v3 in a Three Pack for $67
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchasing three Echo Dot v3s in a bundle costs just $67, bringing the per piece cost to just $22.33 which I think is the best deal on stand alone-Alexa devices. I purchased 2 Echo Inputs and while they work exactly as they should, if given the chance now I’d get the 3-pack of Echo Dot v3 for the extra flexibility. If you don’t need more than one, then by all means grab one of these when they dip to $19.99 (as they do every now and again) for the usual price of $35, check out the Echo Dot v3 as it offers far more flexibility for a few more $.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mondello

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I used this when adding a pair of outdoor speakers by my hot tub. I connected them to a compact audio receiver and used an adapter to go from The Alexa Input’s aux cable to RCA jacks. It’s inside of a plastic storage cabinet and still hears my voice commands perfectly fine. A great way to add Alexa capabilities to a separate stereo/speakers and I plan on putting another one in my workshop. I can even have Alexa start playing music by the hot tub while I’m getting changed before I go outside.
customer_reviews.author: Koda

customer_reviews.title: Heads up if you want to set it up for multi-room music
customer_reviews.text: It serves the purpose, basically. The only problem is when an Echo Input joins a group of other Echo (non-Input) devices for multi-room playing. Echo Input always has a delay. With physical audio cord connecting to speaker, it delays slightly and I can live with it when the speakers are far apart. With bluetooth, don't even think about it... I understand this is perfectly normal for any bluetooth connections but it's still frustrating. Maybe I should try some low-latency solutions with Echo Input.
customer_reviews.author: SW

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Echo Input assuming that like the other Echo products I own, it would stream Apple Music from my linked account, however that is not the case. Instead it gives me an error that the device software needs to be updated through the app, but when I log into the Alexa app it states that the device is running the latest software. Since that is the only reason I bought this device I'll be returning it and going back to plugging my old iPhone into my audio system. This was a big miss Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole M.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional product!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Bose Wave radio CD player. I was watching QVC one night and learned that you can attach one of these to your Bose Wave Radio and play music from your Amazon account. It really opens up your Bose to a whole new world. Very simple to hook up and link to your Amazon Prime Account. All you have to do is say, "Alexa" "Play something by Elton John" and boom, Elton John songs will play till you tell it to stop. AMAZING. If you have a Bose Radio, YOU NEED ONE OF THESE. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: MDHJ

customer_reviews.title: Unique product
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to listen to streaming audio predominantly through a separate bluetooth speaker, this item is the thing you need. It's just like an Echo Dot without an internal speaker. Instead of deploying Echo Dots to be used with my four stereo receivers, I could have used the Echo Input. I like being able to listen to audio by carrying the speaker with me throughout my home. Given its amazingly low price, this item proves to be very valuable.
customer_reviews.author: TimBereman

customer_reviews.title: Very close to what we needed.  Just not stable.
customer_reviews.text: We were in need of a solution that worked using Bluetooth and could connect to a sound group. We use the Alexa devices to play music through music groups so we have music in multiple rooms. The other devices we have would not allow for Bluetooth connection and then function in a music group. This device works for this. It is also nice and small. Now the reason for the 3 stars is the device issues. When working it performs flawlessly and meets our needs. However it continually goes down. We have to reboot it daily as it errors out and becomes unresponsive. If it weren’t for this we would give it 5 stars. Hoping an update will fix this.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Unger

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with the Input; not so happy with the price.
customer_reviews.text: The device itself works well. There are no physical buttons for volume adjustment if you're trying to balance levels with another sound source, but you can adjust the volume by voice or through the Alexa app. There is no ring of lights around the edge like with a dot—just a tiny LED in the center—so it's less useful for notifications. I bought this item as a Prime member on Black Friday for $14.99, when one would expect to get the lowest price. A week later the price dropped to $9.99. I know Amazon does not have a price guarantee for this and it's only five bucks, but the 33% price drop right after purchase is still annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New life for an outdated sound system!
customer_reviews.text: I love this device. It works exactly as advertised. I have an older Bose Wave Radio/CD system that still has amazing sound. Unfortunately, I haven’t played a CD in ages. I wanted a way to Bluetooth enable my Bose. The Echo Input took it a step further. The Input connect to my Bose aux jack so now I can stream Amazon or Apple Music right to my Bose. I had not used my Bose in quite some time, but now I’m using it everyday. I could have done the same thing with a Dot, but the Input was $10 cheaper and gives all the functionality I need. I’ve resurrected a $500 stereo investment! Couldn’t be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Bought this just for the heck of it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on Prime Day. It was cheap, 15 bucks so I thought what the heck and it works great with my bluetooth speaker. However, for 10 dollars more you could buy the Echo Dot and still connect that to your bluetooth speaker with the aux plug or via bluetooth. So if you have a choice get the echo dot, but if you want a flat unobtrusive device, then this will fill the bill. Again, it worked great so I gave it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Great way to upgrade equiptment to artificial intelligence
customer_reviews.text: I love this little gadget. It allows me to modernize my Bose speaker system and connects it to the Alexa world. I really like my speaker and paid a nice chunk of change for it, was sad that it was feeling old and obsolete. Integrating this little gadget into my speaker setup allows me the capability to access Amazon music, Spotify or any other Alexa luxury remotely without spending a lot money. I am a happy acamper again!
customer_reviews.author: Moo

customer_reviews.title: It fills its niche quite well.
customer_reviews.text: It works just like everything else echo based. I would give it a full 5 stars but the delay between saying the wake word and its "ding" to let you know its listening is a full 2 seconds on mine. And that's directly connected with an audio cable. (About the same with BT) Besides the delay it's awesome. I got it at the introductory price. I hope they bring it back down
customer_reviews.author: Random purchaser of things

customer_reviews.title: devices works well, but Alexa app side effects get annoying
customer_reviews.text: replaced an echo already connected to my amp via wired aux port. No issues installing just powered up the input it got on wifi automatically worked well. Soon after Alexa app starts sending configuration notifications to all my device that have the app running, notification to setup the echo input. So ran the setup (makes you view a video animation no way around it) sometimes setup crashed, but made it through setup several times. still getting setup notifications. another issue group devices volume it changes my other echo devices volume sometimes good sometimes bad..
customer_reviews.author: MadMonk

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as an Echo Dot - A Real Turd
customer_reviews.text: I plugged this into my stereo in gameroom, to move the Dot I was using to a different room. This device does not hear requests as well. I have to say the same thing several times for Alexa to respond correctly. Also not convenient, when you can't see it light up from across the room, to tell is Alexa is listening. Luckily, I purchased this when it was on sale. Since my last review, this thing has really gone down hill. Constantly replies it is having troubles connecting. When I check my Alexa App, it shows connected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works a lot better in an auto then the echo auto
customer_reviews.text: This is less expensive than echo auto and works a lot better! This will pair directly with the car. Bluetooth and can use the cars WiFi hotspot. Echo auto can do neither without being paired to a cell phone first. If more than one person uses the car this means you have to setup each time. Echo input does not have that issue. This works great!
customer_reviews.author: GXR

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my application! Patio and deck
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 Echo inputs to use on my covered patio and deck. I wanted a wireless connection between the 2 locations that streamed the same music. This also allows me to control that music from each location. I built a small wooden frame and covered it with ZUINIUBI Speaker Cloth Stereo Grill Fabric Mesh for Audio Brown 55"x19.7"  I also sprayed the fabric with water sealer to help prevent unwanted moisture to get to the Echo. This was a great decision and perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Micromachine

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I initially gave this a poor review as when I first got it, the volume was too low to be usable even on powered speakers, and at that time the Input did not have a volume control option in the Alexa app (I have several Dots and they all had volume control in the app but the Input didn't). Anyways volume control showed up eventually and now it works fine. I don't think it listens quite as well as the Dot which is why I give it 4 stars, but overall it is working fine.
customer_reviews.author: RichardT

customer_reviews.title: Alexa the robot
customer_reviews.text: I decided to give this a whirl and see how the alexa ecosystem is, but I had a hard time with setup, and when I finally did get it to work (briefly as my speaker didnt like to stay connected with it), I discovered that Alexa is very robotic. In comparison to the Google Home mini's we have in our house, Alexa sounds like old windows speech software. Her voice is incredibly machine-like. It doesnt sound at all fluid or natural like Google's does. I could live with the robotic sounding voice, but the fact that my speaker doesnt want to stay connected to this (unlike all my other bluetooth devices I use it with), Ive decided to return it.
customer_reviews.author: A.Kunetka

customer_reviews.title: Works well but could use a bit more power in the 3.5mm jack.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a sound bar in my garage to replace a full size dot. I was excited about this because I really only needed the input. The mic may not be quite as receptive as a regular dot as I feel like sometimes it doesn’t hear me say alexa. My biggest complaint is the weak power of the headphone out jack. With the dot, I kept the dot around 50% volume and could adjust volume by saying hey alexa or using my remote. With the input, I have to keep the input at 100% and adjust volume on the sound bar because lowering the input volume results in barely enough signal for the bar to read
customer_reviews.author: gaterose

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with Echo Input
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of great-sounding computer speakers in the basement. They are old enough that they require an A/C cord with a bulky transformer in the middle. I bought an Input for $19.99 and connected it via the cable that came with the device. For some reason, I didn't have to connect it to my WiFi - it connected by itself. Sound is great via the old Compaq computer speakers. I have a Tap, Echo, two Dots - but this little device is more receptive to my voice than any of the others. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Bailey Sue

customer_reviews.title: Poor instructions
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in - light turns blue, flashes blue for about 5 min, then turns orange and flashes. When I try to download the app on my desktop, I get "site cannot be reached". I don't know whether its defective or what. I'd send it back but I don't want to waste the time or money. Originally had trouble connecting to internet through Amazon 3T Network. Finally connected to home router and now it works. Raised review to 3 stars. Would have rated it higher if not for set up problems. Its a cool unit and connects to my stereo system where its small size lets it hide on top of the receiver.
customer_reviews.author: robert h. thomsen

customer_reviews.title: Buy these!  Amazed and in awe, have more in my cart now.  May buy  lots as gifts
customer_reviews.text: So I wasn’t certain how this might actually work. It’s very small, thin and my expectations were somewhat low. Once I plugged it into my Bose speakers and connected it, I was literally blown away. I quickly turned down the volume so that I didn’t blow the neighbors away as well! The sound was (is) amazing. The quality of the sound out of my Bose speakers is excellent. At this price I sincerely suggest you grab them up. For friends for family. For every room in your home. Just remember you must provide the speaker and it needs to have an audio jack available on the speaker. I am a fan.
customer_reviews.author: DRM1214

customer_reviews.title: Works when it wants to.
customer_reviews.text: I have mine hooked up to a JBL sound bar in the game room. I use Pandora primarily for my music lists and when this device works, everything sounds great. But that unfortunately is only about 25% of the time. The rest of the time is keeps chiming off as though it's awaiting instructions (even when the mic is muted) and for reasons we cannot figure out, it randomly disconnects from the wifi. Nothing else in the house has issues staying connected there, so we're confused. Lastly, it constantly notifies me via the Alexa app that is isn't connected to a speaker. It is, and has been since I installed it, via a 3.5mm jack.
customer_reviews.author: LostMyPen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't know it's playing music!
customer_reviews.text: This device doesn't know that it's playing music when it's part of a group of speakers so you can't control the volume in the app and it doesn't have physical volume buttons for some reason... Amazon could do way better....maybe a software update giving control of volume, bass, etc. whether music is (or perceived as) playing or not. This device needs work. Also the reliability of their server close to me must be corrupted as of late because my music just drops sporadically for no reason while playing canned playlists from Amazon Music. I'm kind of feeling like I should have gone with Google products now.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Almost, but not quite, as good as a Dot
customer_reviews.text: I connected this device with a cable to speakers that I already owned and it works well, except for the fact that it does not show up as an available device when grouping. I have an Echo Dot, a standard Echo and and an Echo Show that are all part of an in-house Music group. Apparently, the Input cannot be grouped along with my other devices. Therefore, it's not as functional as a Dot so I'm glad I bought it at the discounted Daily Deal price. If grouping is a feature you care about then buy a Dot instead.
customer_reviews.author: K. Ward

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Addition to Home Sound System
customer_reviews.text: This Echo Input works perfectly with my sound system. Just add a simple 1/8-inch to two RCA plug adapter and you have a very convenient program source. The sound quality is excellent (with SiriusXM, Pandora, Amazon Music, etc.) and it is nice to be able to switch stations via voice. The Wi-Fi connection is rock-solid and the Echo Input visually pairs nicely with my component system. For the price, this should be considered a must-have item!
customer_reviews.author: LRS

customer_reviews.title: Not as stable at Echo Dot
customer_reviews.text: This video speaks for itself. It says it needs an update, then tells me it is up-to-date.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Defective unit
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure an Echo Input would be a great gadget to use with a bluetooth speaker. The idea is a wonderful one, and the unit itself is tiny and quite nice looking...small enough to be unobtrusive on a table top or dresser. I was impressed with the reviews, so ordered one immediately. Unfortunately, the one I received did not work properly. It would not connect with my speaker, kept shutting itself off, and didn't recognize my voice requests. I felt really bad, but had to return it. I'll stick with my Echo Dot 2nd Generation, which works perfectly alone or with my bluetooth speaker.
customer_reviews.author: BaaBee3

customer_reviews.title: Annoying Notification
customer_reviews.text: The device works fine. Almost any speaker will sound better than a Dot. Only real problem so far is a constant notification from the Alexa app asking for the Echo Input to be connected to a speaker. It is, and always has been connected to a speaker that is powered up 100% of the time. The notification comes up again and again and again and again. Don't think that if you "finish" the Echo Input setup on the Alexa app by watching an insipid video that you'll never see the notification again. Oh no, you'll get it over and over again and over on any device that has the Alexa app installed.
customer_reviews.author: Tc

customer_reviews.title: Does everything an Echo Dot does
customer_reviews.text: If you already have a speaker, this product adds Echo features to it. Setup is the same as other Echo products except you have to add a speaker either by Bluetooth or hard-wired with the supplied cord. The sound quality will be dependant on the speaker you use. I previously had a Dot hard-wired to a speaker but it caused a constant buzzing noise when not in use. The Echo Input eliminated the buzz.
customer_reviews.author: R. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Lacks some functionality
customer_reviews.text: If you have a stereo system you can't live without, then this makes sense. If you want to speak to your speakers which don't have that capability, then the Input is right for you. Otherwise, there is not much benefit to it. I realized quickly it is not compatible for multi room Alexa setups, like other devices are. So this is now a standalone device working with my soundbar in the main den. Used on occasion it provides only marginal value to my life, for the substantial trade-off of having Amazon listen to everything ever said in my home. Get a slightly more expensive model which can integrate with your other devices and create a multi-room streaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. N.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised but...
customer_reviews.text: This little guy does what I needed: drives an external set of speakers. Installed easily and I like the size/shape/appearance. The only issue is that you can not pair an Alexa Voice Remote with it - the option does not appear on the app as it does for the other Alexa devices. They really should disclose this limitation in the documentation. That said, its not the end of the world, as it responds to voice commands without issue. Anyway, if you expect to pair with the Voice Remote, buy a Dot instead.
customer_reviews.author: Bulldog

customer_reviews.title: If it only had a digital output
customer_reviews.text: I'd be willing to pay a lot more. The Chrome Cast Audio ( RIP ) has one, cost about the same but it lacks the Input's ease of use and versatility. With a digital output the Input's SQ would take a quantum leap as it would allow the use of a high quality outboard DAC. In order to get a digital output from an Echo device I'd have to spend $199 for the Echo Link which is seriously overpriced for what it does. Read what the audio forums have to say about the Link. Amazon if you add a digital output to the Input you could sell it for twice the price.
customer_reviews.author: Poultrygeist

customer_reviews.title: A bargain "Echo-Dot-without-a-speaker"
customer_reviews.text: The Echo Input has all the functionality and performance of the Echo Dot, but without a speaker. On sale, this item was less than half the price ($10 during the 2019 holiday season) of the Echo Dot. Given that I use a Bluetooth speaker with my Echo Dot, this unit replaced my family room Echo Dot so that I could use it in another part of the house. The Echo Input is about the same size, but much thinner than the Dot. The Echo Input can also optionally be hard wired to an amplified speaker. All cables and the AC adapter/power supply are included. Well made, well packaged and performs well.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Smookler

customer_reviews.title: Get the dot.
customer_reviews.text: I had my dot hooked up to my stereo system. I replaced it with the input and now when I set timer or alarms they go off on other dots in the house. Also has a annoying distracting chime when it hears the wake up word.
customer_reviews.author: todd connolly

customer_reviews.title: Cannot be paired to any speaker that needs a passcode, 3.5mm jack produces screeches.
customer_reviews.text: This device cannot link to any Blutooth speaker that requires a passcode (like 0000 or 1234) to pair with. So I was forced to try and use the 3.5mm accessory jack. Using the Aux-Out cable there was so much screeching and feedback it was unbearable. The noise persisted at all times the device was plugged in, whether I was using Alexa or not... A replacement unit was sent to me, and it had the same problem. I tried multiple aux-cords. I tried multiple Echo Input devices. I cannot recommend this device, even though I am a big fan (and user) of the other Amazon Echo products.
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: Echo/Alexa on any speaker, multiple rooms
customer_reviews.text: I currently have an echo spot, but wanted to get another echo/alexa device in my living room BOSE soundlink speaker. connecting this Echo input was easy enough and setup time with the Alexa app was also straightforward. now i can ask my living room speaker to play news, tell me about my day, play music, etc.. Bonus, i setup a multi room group so that my echos pot and my echo input/Bose speaker play in stereo in each room (unfortunately no left/right channel selection) Will purchase a second one and add more speakers or use my receiver/sound system to make it "smart"
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jurado

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for :)
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted. I have external speakers and didn’t want to spend the extra $10 for an Alexa Dot. This is priced just right and paired quickly to my Samsung Sound-bar. My only (minor) gripe is that the Input has troubling hearing me when the music is too loud. The actual microphone range is great. It can hear me from the other room when it’s relatively quiet. However if the music is up pretty loud and I’m right near the Input I have to project my voice to give an Alexa command. I hope future models have more microphones built in.
customer_reviews.author: AtoZ Customer

customer_reviews.title: For the most - great!
customer_reviews.text: The design purpose of the Echo input functions as advertised and superbly, other that the usual customer reported experienced issuers of the "Drop In" and "Calling" features intended for room to fromm/Echo to Echo communications between users in different rooms that now and again (to often) fails, in one way or another, proving not to reliable. I often get, "there is no Alexa device in that ... room" or "Drop in is not available for..." or " ... room doesn't support that" when attempting to call a given room or area that an Alex device has been deignated/assigned. This can be quite irritating, going from properly functioning/recognizing to not doing so.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but a doorstop!
customer_reviews.text: OK! I really loathe bluetooth! That said, I was still willing to try this technology as a remote way to control my other Echo devices without opening my Android tablet every time. Within 5 minutes, I knew I would return the Echo Input. My first clue is that no matter how many ways I tried to change its wake word, I couldn't. I did get it paired to my Echo Spot, but no matter what commands I gave, spot would not run (or jump!) Now that the pairing is done, it looks like a lifetime bond. How do I get a divorce from the Echo Input? Do I need a lawyer and a court decree?
customer_reviews.author: ALS

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother
customer_reviews.text: Every time the echo input is used I get a notification to set up a Bluetooth speaker on my iphone. EVERY TIME. I do NOT want to use a Bluetooth speaker that is why I have it plugged into the speaker with the supplied cable. I have gone over the set up and chose wired set up 20 times and it still sends me the same message. My $20 input is currently in a desk drawer where it will stay until there is a fix for this annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Quite the steal at $9.99, perfect device for an entertainment system.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use with my 7.1 surround sound AV receiver so that I could stream music in a much higher quality than any of the built-in-speaker Alexa devices could offer. For such a low price it adds Alexa, Bluetooth streaming, and Echo guard functionality. My only complaint is that it does not offer drop-in support which is a bit of a shame. Make sure to tell the Echo to set the volume to at least 7, and then adjust your receiver. I leave the Echo Input set at 10 and use the AV receiever remote to control volume without any distortion.
customer_reviews.author: 5koliny

customer_reviews.title: Bose Wave III Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Connected this to my Bose Wave III radio. Saved me from upgrading. I had to do some tweaking on the radio settings but its now Alexa enabled
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: This Allows a Non-Alexa Speaker to Simulate an Alexa Speaker
customer_reviews.text: For about $10 I was able to adapt a non-Alexa speaker to interface almost perfectly with the Amazon.com database. My only reservation is that the wireless network connection needs to be re-established following current interruptions which is a bit of a hassle. However, that might be true of the more expensive Amazon-Alexa devices with which I have no experience. The message is that if you have a high quality speaker you would like to adapt to the Amazon-Alexa system, this does the job almost perfectly and at a trivial cost.
customer_reviews.author: Alan M. Ruben

customer_reviews.title: Great at $20, but no EQ.
customer_reviews.text: An Echo Dot with wired Bose speakers is set up in one of my bedrooms. I bought the Echo Input to replace the Dot, freeing the Dot up for use in another room where its built-in speaker could be used. The Input was easy to set up, but I found that unlike the Dot, the Input has no EQ control. Me speakers have no EQ control, so with the Input connected, I have no way of adjusting the tone. The little Bose speakers are too bass heavy for voice, so this is a problem for me. It seems like an odd oversight to not include EQ on a device that must rely on external speakers for operation.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chadwick

customer_reviews.title: Alexa Auto for all
customer_reviews.text: Alexa auto for the people. Bought this for $10 over Christmas for my car. I connect it to my vehicle or phone hotspot. It works. Being used to Alexa at home which is always connected to the internet. There is a delay at first after connecting to the internet. I turn mine on and don't start using it for about 5 or more minutes. Works great. I love dropping-in on the rooms at my house to listen or talk to the family. Tip: Use the aux cable instead of Bluetooth. This way your phones Bluetooth will not be interrupted.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Jones

customer_reviews.title: No EQ function.  Sound quality fully depends on speaker.
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't support or have basic sound control functions like and equalizer. You CAN NOT control treble or bass to clean up the sound quality. I wouldn't suggest purchasing one until this type of basic function is available. This was a major disappointment to find out since it has to be connected to an external speaker. What this means is that payback sound (highs/mids/lows) will be completely dependant on the speaker. Such a simple add that it's a shame i purchased it to play Pandora and other music apps only to find out later its all muddy with excess bass that can't be adjusted.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Shoemaker

customer_reviews.title: Works w Powered Speakers
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something to plug into Soundbar and one to plug into portable speaker. Both are more powerful than the tweeters and woofers in the standard Echos (excluding Echo Studio). It worked great with the portable speaker but not so great with the Soundbar. It sounded weak via aux wire. Maybe would have been better with a Bluetooth connection. So in the latter case, will keep using remote to access Pandora or Spotify. For $10, easy to add to your Alexa household and use the stereos you probably still have sitting around.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Ray

customer_reviews.title: It looks great, hooked up easy, sounds excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I have had my Echo Input a while but just got around to hooking it up. We have 11 Echos of various kinds including 2 Echo shows... some where an Echo is playing all the time.. generally more than one. Got a refurbished 1970s Marantz receiver this week attached to some nice Klipsch speakers... so I had a new place to try out an Input. Ok the tiny Input is completely cool... looks great.. attached easily... and of course sounds great. It shuffling songs by Mozart right now. Tool cool. I have one more. I hope Amazon keeps selling them.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great device to place in a small room
customer_reviews.text: The device was absolutely one of the simplest devices I've ever installed. And, getting it to pair with a Bluetooth speaker (which is required) worked flawlessly - on the first attempt, I've placed my Echo Input on a nightstand in the bedroom and paired it with a tiny (yet powerful) speaker from Anker. While the combination of these two devices would never be accused of creating a high-fidelity listening experience, they do work great as an alarm clock, checking the weather, getting the day's "Flash Report,: etc. Sothe Echo Input a perfect addition to the Alexa family of products.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great Support 2nd time
customer_reviews.text: I have the Echo Dot and tried to connect it with my Bose Wave radio. I saw it on QVC and it seemed like a good item to try. Once I connected this with my Bose unit, the Echo Dot's volume was very low even though the Bose volume was up high. I contacted Bose and the unit was fine. I contacted Amazon and was finally able to get someone on the phone. After a few troubleshooting steps, the Echo Dot still had a low sound through the Bose system. The support tech from Amazon walked with me through the entire process and finally recommended a replacement. Thank you Amazon for following up for the second support call.
customer_reviews.author: DCMAGNUM

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic. I preordered and works just as good, if not better than my other alexa products. It is used every day in my house and we've never had a problem. Bought it around Christmas and still going strong. Would highly recommend this product. I don't know if you need to have other alexa products for this to work, as I already had other alexa products before I bought this one. It is very slim and easy to stash around the house.
customer_reviews.author: chelsey potter

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative for the echo auto
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it, it's currently being used in my car until I can get my hands on the echo auto. It works with Bluetooth in my car getting the connection from the hotspot on my phone it does basically everything my other Alexa products can do. I like the fact the minute I get into my car with the hotspot on it connects automatically. If your wanting Alexa on the go this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie

customer_reviews.title: Works great with my Bose player, better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, I do LOVE this, paired with the Bose I recently purchased. Love being able to stream a wide variety of music (and audiobooks!) on the Bose, and it sounds amazing (for MP3, anyway). CDs will always sound better, as the files aren't compressed, and it's a noticeable difference, but I was really pleasantly surprised at how good this combo plays together. Super handy. And the Echo Input is TINY! I love the small size and unobtrusiveness of it. I hadnt looked at the dimensions when I ordered, so this was really a nice surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: No drop-in (intercom) functionality
customer_reviews.text: One of the functionalities that’s important to me is being able to use my Echo Dots & Inputs between different rooms of the house. I was very disappointed to find that Echo Input doesn’t support this. This doesn’t seem to be a hardware limitation, as obviously it has microphones and is connected to a speaker in all but the most edge cases. It seems that Amazon limits this functionality via software.
customer_reviews.author: B. Soo

customer_reviews.title: It works well!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to integrate music into my hole home amplifier, I initially was going to use a competitors product but that was discontinued earlier this year. it works great though for my use case. I wish that it's implementation was a bit different from a standard alexa though. inorder to have it play music in my amp one has to say "alexa, play music in attic". I wish there was to set it as the standard music player in a home so one would only have to say "alexa, play music" and it would select the source. it is a small complaint and it works great!.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E.

customer_reviews.title: Poor  connection to Bluetooth devices OR poor WiFi connection from this device
customer_reviews.text: Have connected the device to a couple different Bluetooth speakers. Audio cuts out even though the Echo Input device is only a few feet away. Cant tell if it is the actual Bluetooth connection or the Echo Input's WiFi connection. I have a Gen 1 echo device in the same locale and it never cuts out with the wired audio cable connection. Would NOT recommend this device!
customer_reviews.author: B Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great for in-wall/in-ceiling speakers!
customer_reviews.text: We used one of these to connect to the receiver that is hooked up to our in wall and in ceiling speakers. It did not want to hookup to the Bluetooth at first, but after googling it I found a solution: say “Alexa, pair” and then it worked. Using the app, we created speaker groups with our other Echo devices, and it’s pretty cool. Will be getting another one for our garage/outdoor speakers and the receiver in our bonus room. It’s a WAY more affordable way to make our older speaker system “smart.”
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, affordable; not good for powered speakers
customer_reviews.text: I have a speaker that is powered by a 5v USB. It has an AUX in. When I plug this Alexa Echo Input unit, the two power sources create a HUMMMMMM in the speaker, like it's overpowered. When I use Bluetooth or a headphones, it's just fine. Overall, this is a GREAT way to add an Alexa microphone to each room of the house, expecially if you aren't requiring feedback - you can just plug in a dummy jack to the headphones, OR a mini speaker just to hear the 'ok'.  is an example
customer_reviews.author: Billie Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: So unhappy.
customer_reviews.text: So unhappy with this. I love all of my echos but this one has been such a disappointment. I bought this to hook up to my sound system so it could be apart of my multi room music. It worked for about 3 months then all of a sudden it stopped. If I barely plug in the aux cable the sound comes through but it is somewhat muted. When I plug the aux cable completely in i don’t hear anything at all. I thought it was my cable so I bought a new one. Nope. Same problem. Super annoyed because I really wanted this to work.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: Major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace the device after 3 months, as it constantly shut itself down. Again, after 3 months, the device began to malfunction. The replacement's voice recognition was terrible, failing to recognize apps, including Amazon music stations and playlists. Tossed it just before Christmas to purchase a different brand's comparable device.
customer_reviews.author: NYNic

customer_reviews.title: A Better Option Than The Alternatives
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit primarily to allow for music streaming through my older model home theater system. I originally using a popular alternative offering but was having issues with audio statics. Everything else in my home is Alexa-based so going with the Input was an easy choice. I have noticed that the mic on the input base is not nearly as sensitive as on my other Echo devices but I have Echos covering all critical areas so this is kind of a moot point. The audio quality is solid and static-free. That I am able to use this with my existing multi-room audio setup is a big bonus.
customer_reviews.author: A. Martin

product_meta.title: Echo Input – Bring Alexa to your own speaker- Black
feature_bullets: Echo Input adds Alexa to an external speaker and connects via 3.5 mm audio cable or Bluetooth.
Can hear you from across the room—even when music is playing. Echo Input is also designed around your privacy. You can press the microphone off button to electronically disconnect the microphones.
Stream Amazon Music, Apple Music, Spotify, Pandora, SiriusXM, and more on your favorite speaker.
Just ask Alexa to play a song, read the news, or check the weather and traffic.
Set alarms and timers, add items to your to-do list, and control compatible smart home devices.
Calling and Drop In via Bluetooth is currently not supported.
Alexa is always getting smarter and adding new skills like tracking fitness, playing games, and more.
Slim, low-profile design fits almost anywhere.
